titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Paul Shepard Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Diane Kaplan

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:01

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, research notes, drafts of writings, and published essays and book reviews by Paul Shepard. The papers also include reviews of Shepard's work, letters Shepard wrote to his parents during his military service in Europe during World War II and as a graduate student in the Conservation Program at Yale University, and letters from his friend and co-author Daniel McKinley. Other materials include grant proposals, genealogical files, personal papers, photographic slides, digital images, and legal materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the donor of this collection for materials authored or otherwise produced by Paul H. Shepard, Jr. After the lifetime of the donor, copyright will transfer to the children of Paul H. Shepard, Jr. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Paul Shepard Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paul Howe Shepard, Jr. received a Ph.D. from Yale University and taught natural philosophy and ecology at Pitzer College and Claremont Graduate School in California. His writings on the interrelationships between humans and the environment are provocative, literary, and mystical, as much as scientific. Shepard died in July 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, research notes, drafts of writings, and published essays and book reviews by Paul Shepard. The papers also include reviews of Shepard's work, letters Shepard wrote to his parents during his military service in Europe during World War II and as a graduate student in the Conservation Program at Yale University, and letters from his friend and co-author Daniel McKinley. Other materials include grant proposals, genealogical files, personal papers, photographic slides, digital images, and legal materials.

scopecontent.p: This accession is composed of teaching and research notes. The folder titles and order represent the materials as received from the donor. Abbreviations, spelling, and punctuation have not been changed.

scopecontent.p: This accession is composedof research notes, manuscripts, personal papers, genealogical files, legal records, and images. The folder titles and order represent the materials as received from the donor. Abbreviations, spelling, and punctuation have not been changed.
